properties.name: Azalea Trail
properties.notes:
Azalea Trail https://www.nps.gov/places/azalea-trail.htm

Walk the Azalea Trail through the forest of Greenbelt Park. (1.2 miles)

The trailheads begin in the Sweetgum picnic area and ends in the Sweetgum Picnic area. Pick up a park brochure with trail maps and descriptions included in the brochure) and enjoy a 1.2 mile walk. 
Parking available at the Sweetgum Picnic Area.

properties.name: Dogwood Trail
properties.notes:
Dogwood Trail https://www.nps.gov/places/dogwood-trail.htm

Dogwood Trail

The trailhead begins and ends in the Dogwood parking area. Enjoy a 1.4 or 1.6 mile walk through the forest of Greenbelt Park.

properties.name: Greenbelt Park
properties.notes:
Greenbelt Park https://www.nps.gov/places/000/greenbelt-park.htm

Greenbelt Park is a forested oasis amid the city, and the closest campground to the White House. The park offers camping and ranger programs. Metro accessible via a short hike.

properties.name: Holly Picnic Area - Reservations Only
properties.notes:
Holly Picnic Area - Reservations Only https://www.nps.gov/places/holly-picnic-area.htm

The Holly Picnic Area is located near the entrance of the park. When entering the park, proceed to the stop sign. Make a left turn and the Holly picnic area is on your right hand side.

The Holly picnic area can accomodate up to 200 people. There are 99 parking spaces. There are picnic tables and restrooms. A Recreation Fee is charged according to the number of particpants.

Make a reservation

properties.name: Laurel Picnic Area- Reservations Only
properties.notes:
Laurel Picnic Area- Reservations Only https://www.nps.gov/places/laurel-picnic-area-reservations-only.htm

The Laurel Reserved Picnic Area is located on the loop of the park. When entering the park, proceed to the stop sign. Make a left turn and pass the Holly picnic area (on your right hand side) and proceed to Laurel Picnic Area on your right hand side. 

The Holly Reserved Picnic Area can accomodate up to 200 people. There are 99 parking spaces. There are picnic tables and restrooms. A Recreation Fee is charged according to the number of particpants.

Make a reservation

properties.name: Perimeter Trail
properties.notes:
Perimeter Trail https://www.nps.gov/places/perimeter-trail.htm

Perimeter Trail

Enjoy the 5.3 mile Perimeter Trail.

If arriving by vehicle, parking is available at the Sweetgum Picnic area.
If arriving by foot, the beginning of the Perimeter trail begins near the park entrance.

properties.name: Sweetgum Picnic Area
properties.notes:
Sweetgum Picnic Area https://www.nps.gov/places/sweetgum-picnic-area.htm

Sweetgum Picnic Area is open. 

Sweetgum Picnic Area is a first-come first serve picnic area. There are two sets of playground equipment, a baseball field with backstop, and a large field .

There is a limit of 4 tables and 24 people per group so that everyone may enjoy this area.

There are picnic tables and a restroom in this area.
If your group is larger than 25 people, you can reserve the reserved picnics areas (Holly and Laurel) available for large groups by reserving a picnic area through recreation.gov 

Upon entering the park, proceed to the stop sign. Make a right hand turn and the Sweetgum Picnic Area is the first left.
